{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-074-15-A |Item_parent=Prescription and monitoring of psychotropic drugs (see item 330) |Item_parent_short=Prescription and monitoring of psychotropic drugs (see item 330) |Rank=A |Heading=Anxiolytics: knowledge of frequent or serious adverse effects, main drug interactions at all stages of life, particularly in elderly patients. |Description=None |Rubric=Management |Contributors= |Order=15}} ==Undesirable effects== {| class="wikitable" |+ For all: possible allergic reactions.
|'''Chemical class''' |'''Adverse reactions''' |'''Management''' |- | rowspan="7" |'''Benzodiazepines''' |Sedation : *Daytime sleepiness, asthenia, dizziness, impaired alertness. *Potentiated by alcohol | *Patient information, particularly with regard to driving. *Adaptation of doses |- |Cognitive alterations : *memory impairment and impaired reaction capacity *Confusion may occur in the elderly | *Adaptation of doses, cautious discontinuation if confusion. |- | *Behavioural disorders favoured by alcohol: *Disinhibiting effect | rowspan="3" | *Do not combine with alcohol *Contraindicated for subsequent prescription of benzodiazepines. |- | *Paradoxical reactions favoured by alcohol *Agitation and aggression |- | *Amnesic automatic actions: in impulsive patients, which may have medico-legal consequences. |- | *Pharmacological dependence and withdrawal syndrome when treatment is stopped. *Use disorder | *Respect the rules for stopping treatment (gradual reduction). |- | *Anxiety rises when treatment is stopped | *Monitoring progress |- |Azapirones | *Nausea, headache at the start of treatment | *Wait, symptomatic treatment |- |H1 antihistamine | *Sedation, daytime somnolence, asthenia, dizziness, impaired alertness. *Potentiated by alcohol *QT prolongation | *Patient information, particularly with regard to driving. *Adaptation of doses |} == Main drug interactions * There are no formally contraindicated associations with benzodiazepines, but certain pharmacodynamics must be taken into account: potentiation of sedative effects by any other CNS depressant. * Antihistamines: avoid combinations with other anticholinergics and other CNS depressants.

question.question: Which of the following is NOT a recommended management strategy for benzodiazepine-related adverse effects in elderly patients?
question.option_a: Patient information regarding the effects on driving.
question.option_b: Gradual reduction of doses to prevent withdrawal syndrome.
question.option_c: Combination with alcohol to enhance therapeutic effects.
question.option_d: Cautious discontinuation if confusion or behavioral disorders occur.
